rComments: I really liked Berman. I had taken calc in high school, and he might be a bit confusing if you've never taken it before. He doesn't post his notes online, but his midterms and finals are just like the reviews. You'll do great as long as you know everything on there. (I had him for 11B too, ended that with an A)

This guys is incredibly misunderstood. Yeah, his lectures are long and he takes 30 minutes going over one problem, but he does this because he explains EVERYTHING. For people who never taken calc, go to MSI or TA.  If you fail this class, I would guess it's because you never went to help. His test are super straightforward and easy.  Easiest A.

His lectures are really boring. It is not hard to pass his class. If you do the homework and DO HIS REVIEW you will pass the class easily. His exams are the exactly problems to his reviews, just different numbers. If you fail his exams, it's clear you didn't get help on his review or study enough.

Taking his class is an easy A. Although his class is very boring and dry, the class notes are the same questions in the test. His tests are short and he usually chooses repetitively easy problems. Advice for class: Take notes in class (you dont have to listen, I usually had head phones in) but these are the questions on the test Study guide
Lectures are very helpful and very easy to understand. His sample problems are very well explain. The test are super easy if you do his study guide

I had berman for 11A and 11B and his exams are pretty much straight off of the study guide. Know how to do the problems on the study guide well and I promise that you will do just fine. As for a professor, he does go off on tangents, but he does explain his problems very thoroughly.

this class was pretty easy because of the sections i attended as well as MSI. If i would have relied on group study or just lectures i would have barely passed. I strongly recommend attending additional sections and MSI.

Took 11A/B- His class itself is mostly explanation and examples, so you can get away with not showing up, but he goes through it all so thoroughly that you will understand how he got his answers. He also explains small parts of the theory, and you can meet him for the rest. His tests are v easy, he takes answers almost exactly from the review sheet

Rambles A LOT during class time and does not stay on topic. I had him for 11A as well as 11B. It's no surprise when he spends the entire class period on one example problem. He gives excessive notes, you'll be just fine without the notes (they don't help!). Study guides are ten times harder than the actual short (5-7 question) exams.

Berman is very dry & his lectures are extremely boring. His dry speech & fast talking often make it hard to pay attention, he goes off on tangents that are not easy to follow. The course isn't too bad. You may have to teach yourself, but tests are exactly like review sheets & what is expected is clearly communicated. Don't buy textbook (11A/B).
Berman is a cool dude. He really tries to help if you have the time to go to his office hours. Other than that, study the review sheets!

Berman is a great teacher and SUPER EASY TO GET AN A IN. He genuinely cares about passing his students. Memorize his review sheets and you are guaranteed an A in his class.  TESTS ARE MUCH EASIER THAN THE REVIEW SHEET. Sections are not mandatory but "weekly" quizzes are given there (we only had 3 all year, he will inform u beforehand).
Berman is a really great guy. I enjoyed his lectures and his tests are very easy.

I'll be honest, Berman is that professor who is an absolute genius in higher level math. But taking calculus for the first time with Berman was a mistake. He assumes that we know the basics already and dives straight into the harder concepts of calculus. He takes forever doing math problems & his explanations are just him thinking aloud to himself.

Lectures are unproductive. Only 3-5 problems are done in the lecture time. His midterms are very similar to his review sheets so study those. You don't really have to attend if you have previous experience with calculus.
Berman turns very simple questions into very long explanations.  However, I liked him because he was very clear as to what would be on his tests.  Know the study guide and get an A.
MY MAN BERMAN! Some sort of magician, he can take a simple problem and...  *POOF* turn it into a 30 minute explanation!
Not many people take the chance to go to his office hours. He's a pretty nice guy once you get to know him and is very understanding.

Terrible lecturer. If you have never taken calculus before you will have a hard time getting above a C in the class. Study your ass off maybe you'll pull a B. Everyone else with experience passes the class which is why the average isn't a 50 percent.
Really enjoyed this class. His lectures were really clear and tests are easy.

Berman can be confusing during lectures but his review sheets make up for his confusing teaching methods. If you know how to do every problem on the reviews you'll know how to do the exams. Grades are heavily weighted on tests so you have to study hard for them. Exams are very short but not too difficult.
Worst teacher ever! Never explains anything clearly. Not a good teacher. His tests are basically the study guides.

Berman was great for me. Perhaps because I am interested in math and can grasp it easily, but his tests were easy and straightforward. I find myself taking other math classes and wishing they were taught by Abe. He's strange (the whole same shirt, never-ending beard and nails situation), but he gets his job done. People who complain simply dont try

BERMAN IS HORRIBLE. I hated this class and pretty much everyone else in my class felt the same way. His lectures are VERY hard to follow, he talks about random things and makes it difficult to focus. He's NOT inspirational at all DOES NOT care about his students.

I emailed him so many times asking for help. Never replied. He's lectures are pretty much useless unless you want to know what's going to be on your future calculus course. Tests are pretty much the same as the guides. Master all the study guides.
He tends to go off on tangents, skips steps and doesnt clarify so youre left saying what the heck just happened
Berman's classes are always easy as long as you show up to class, do your homework, and understand your materials.

Berman's class is fair. He covers all necessary material. He gives representative homework problems. And his tests are almost exactly like his study guides, except easier! Do all the homework, figure out the study guide before the test. Getting an "A" is straightforward (A's are 90%+). Helpful during office hours. Happy I took him.

Attending lecture is a huge waste of time. Can't teach to save his life, not a professor to take if you want a good understanding of the material. Study the hell out of his practice exams and his class is a joke

Lectures were extremely hard to follow.  I just did not find him to be super good at explaining things.  If I could go back in time I would have not wasted time attending class and elected to only go to section instead.

Prof B. is an interesting guy, pretty sure he didn't shave, cut his fingernail, or change his shirt the entire quarter. Besides that, he likes math and gives out study guides which are carbon copies of the tests. DO THE STUDY GUIDES!

Easy A as long as you are decent at math. Just go to section and if you're really struggling go to MSI too. Just study review sheets and you will get an A, however; you won't learn anything unless you actually pay attention in lecture.

People hate Berman. 1.He gives a ton of examples. 2.If you ask for help he will give examples. I love this method of teaching, the more you practice the more you'll understand it. P.S. study the crap out of the midterm reviews and final reviews and you will no doubt receive an A , guarantee.
Lectures meandered and topics were introduced in the most complex way possible.  Illogical progression of concepts in lectures.

Berman is an awful math teacher.. you can tell his interest in teaching the material was just not there. He often took very simple concepts and made them extremely complicated. His tests were pretty straight forward if you do all the worksheets.

He's an okay teacher, but it bothers me when he's late to his own lectures. It's a waste of my time and everybody else's time in order to learn the material and he ends up not be able to complete the lesson, so it rolls over into the next lecture. This process repeats until the class is one or two sections behind.

The lecture was pretty boring. He just summarizes the book. Few examples but heavy on proofs and definitions. Because there was no practice exam it was difficult to study for, but looking back, the exams were fair enough. Homework problems and the little examples in class are your only study sources.

Berman "answers" questions by talking in circles. He just wastes time without helping. One HW problem baffled most of the class. Berman showed an old proof that he couldn't explain. In addition to useless lectures, Berman provides no study guides or review. The syllabus says you can attend section instead of lecture. Make sure you can attend. . . .

Berman is a cool dude. A lot of people disliked the way he taught, but this notes are super clear and thorough. He is used to teaching upper div. classes, which might confuse people, but he always encourages to take another Math class and this class makes it possible. I like him. Overall the midterms were a piece of cake. Homework is doable.
His class was super easy. He doesn't seem very interested in this class and he wasn't the most interesting teacher, but he got the material across. His midterms and final were also easy.

Berman spent the entire time going theorem then 10 examples. He doesn't lay a logical framework, he just tries to pound it in. He is not a very effective teacher but his exams are extremely easy and his review sheets are nearly verbatim what are on his exams.

Berman doesn't know how to teach in a lecture room of 300 students. He's boring and I couldn't understand him at times. However, he does make up for it in the midterms and final, which are based off the worksheets. If you practice example problems and do the worksheets you should be fine in the class.

Lectures were pretty boring and review sheets were hard, but the actual midterm/finals were extremely easy. Class did bad on 2nd midterm, but he made the final easier. Takes forever to explain examples, but similar ones show up on tests
Horrible at lecturing. Very easy grader, tests are ridiculously easy, but barely learned anything the whole class.
Class time was spent primarily on example problems. Tests were significantly easier than the review sheets.

He used to teach upper division math courses, so his approach to teaching precalc is sometimes a little more complicated then it needs to be and his lectures can drag.  His test problems come right from the worksheets, so section group work (where you complete the worksheets) is the key to success

Up until the first midterm he showed up late to class and was not that good at explaining things. However, he made a big change for the better following this and did a great job for the rest of the year. First midterm was easy,Second was very easy,final was on the difficult side but nothing unreasonable. I got an A without much work.
Very easy as long as you know how to do the hw and review sheet problems. In class, he explains how to do all the different kinds of problems that are on the hw (and some of the review sheet).

2nd time taking math 11b. took it with Eastman the first time, put SO much time trying to learn everything but got a D. took it with Berman and barely put any effort and got a 100% on both midterms. His tests are exactly like the problems he does in class, the easy hw problems, and a way easier version of his review.He made Calculus enjoyable!
not bad

He goes through lectures pretty fast and skips over a lot of the steps because he expects you to kinda just "know it", and isn't very good at clarifying. Midterms and finals are all ok, if you do the practice exams you'll be fine. Because he wasn't clear I had to use the textbook a lot.

This man should not be a professor. His lectures are unclear and he shows no interest in the success of his students. He is unprofessional because of his appearance and tardiness. My TA was almost as bad at teaching than he was. Don't trust his good ratings. Avoid taking his class at all costs.

Awesome professor. Super clear, grades very fairly, the practice mid-term and final are almost identical to the real ones. He's super weird, never changes his shirt, but he's my favorite math professor I've ever had.
Berman is the preferred math teacher. His practice tests are exactly like his real tests. He usually picks about 6 problems off his practice tests and puts them on the test.

The subject material offered in this class was beyond my understanding (mainly bc I didn't have enough time to sit down and try to understand what was being taught).  However, the way the class is structured, I managed to get a solid A in the class.  Berman will give you practice exam questions about 15-20 of them.  6 or 7 will be on the final.

His teaching is very good if you can keep up with what he is speaking about. he will go off on tangents and formalize a theorem, even though completely unnecessary. Also I found his lack of communication with the TAs frustrating, as they would teach the same concepts in a different way.

His tests are exactly like the review so it's pretty easy to do well on the tests. But be beware, he is extremely boring and monotonous. He crammed most of the class into the last few weeks which was annoying, and he also is very unprofessional as far as appearance and punctuality. If you can, take the class from a different professor.

Berman is honestly really good. While he is not super easy to understand when he lectures, he always is very clear on what you need to know, how to do it, and gives great practice exams that are really helpful. He does wear the same cloths every day, which is weird, but still a very good and straight-forward teacher.

Berman is a really great professor.  He teaches in a way to make everyone understand, the class itself isn't easy for everyone but if you take it with him, getting a C will be harder than getting an A.
If you want a easy way out of 19A, Berman is your man. He is very easy, no need to go to class, midterms are exactly like the review, homework is easy and section TA's are nice too.
Cool Dude :)

Great professor! Go to class, take notes and you should do fine. His exams are literally the EXACT SAME as the review sheet he provides. However, the review sheet can be lengthy and quite hard so make sure you ask your TA for all the answers and how to solve them. do HW!!
very good teacher, teaches exactly what he expects you to know. Exams are straightforward and averages are usually pretty high so no curve.
often unclear in lecture but very approachable during office hours. his exams are generally fair.

Abe's a cool guy. The midterms and final were almost exactly like the practice ones. The homework online was a lot harder, but you get 3 tries and it gives you all the answers after the first try. It's an easy A if you study the practice tests and keep up.

He's a really nice guy. Approachable. I must say he knows his stuff.  But his examples are useless. He only gives us about two examples from each section. How are we suppose to learn that way? Go to section, ask the TA for help. Or if not read the book yourself and understand it. And seriously his homework is WAY harder than his exams.
Great instructor, knows the material, and was always willing to take time out and help you out. Way too much homework, and some of the problems are harder than anything on the exams.
I give the man credit for his genius, but even with the reasonably coherent lectures and TAs the material is just not easy to get in your head without a sledgehammer.

Berman is, quite simply, predictable. He's a great professor to take if you don't want surprises in your math class, which can be a good or bad thing. Basically he'll show to lecture, explain what you need to know, and then leave. The tests are reasonable difficulty and his grading is pretty fair. Don't expect to be wowed.

Berman was a good teacher, but unfortunately he wasn't good at explaining. He tends to go into many complicated definitions without any prior context. My favorite quote is, "if it doesn't make sense... think about a it for a few minutes." Did great examples on the board and fair tests (all things he already covered).

Ehh Berman is alright. Expect weekly homework and also sign up for a weekly section, they're mandatory (whenever the weekly 2 question quiz is given, at least). Lectures are boring but survivable. Pretty dry teacher who stays on a few topics for quite a long time.  Midterms and finals are okay.

Berman is a really good guy, but he's just not the best teacher. He is really smart, yet has a hard time "dumbing" it down for newcomers. He would be a wonderful upper-division math teacher. His class is still easily passable and easy to get an A if you apply yourself. Go to Sections, do the Study Guides. His study guides are literally the test.

Berman is clear in his grading and directions, and his tests were not bad if you went to your lectures and sections. I would say take advantage of the many resources, and you will be doing good in his class. Also, there are weekly quizzes in section (not as bad as it sounds), there are two midterms, and a final. The homework load is fine.
Berman Is A1

Berman moves at a fast pace to get all the material in in only 10 weeks. If you're not very good at math like me, might want to attend every class. No quizzes or anything extra on top of midterms, final, and webassign assignments. Make use of section. That's where most questions can be asked.  Minimal effort, you'll pass.

A pretty easy class. There was a lot to do for the class (homework, worksheets, section quizzes,  2 midterms, and a final) but if you did everything it was easy to get a good grade. The worksheets aren't mandatory but DO THEM! It makes the test so much easier. Pretty bland lecturer and it's hard for him to answer simple questions, but not too bad.
Do the review sheets and study a lot and you should have no problem passing. Tests were very fair in my opinion.

The review sheets are the most important things EVER. If you study those and know them super well then you will pass the class. He's okay, He's a pretty nice guy, but he's horrid at explaining, you basically have to teach yourself. His test are exactly like the review sheets, the TA's are pretty helpful, and the weekly quizzes are easy. It was okay

Not a great prof - I feel that he doesn't want to be there. Lots of material to cover and he does problems in confusing ways. Midterms and finals are very similar to his review sheets so do those sheets. The class was doable even though I had no previous precalc experience. Def go to MSI if you need help and go to class

The class is fast-paced because there's a lot of material to cover, so that may be a challenge. Grading is fair. Grades are based on homework, weekly quizzes, review sheets, and exams. The review sheets are especially important for knowing the material on the exams. Do well on those and you should be fine for the midterms and final.

Honestly, just go to class and take notes. Take notes on his examples and you'll understand how to do the review sheets. The review sheets that he gives out are really similar to his midterm and final. If you do that, then you should be fine. His lectures are pretty confusing but his tests are fair.

I'm sorry but the fact that Berman has an easiness rating any less than "5" is ridiculous. Easiest teacher of all time. Haven't attended lecture since the first midterm, now the class is a week away from finals and I still have 100% in the class. His exams are composed of questions pulled straight from the review sheet and made EASIER.

so, i'm going to fail his class. my fault, i messed up really, really badly on a midterm. he's not a very clear teacher. i'd suggest you take 11b with somebody else if you want a prof who is an, ah,  exceptional teacher. totally doable, though. his study guides (so far!) have been exactly like his tests
Easy MidtermFinal. His class isnt necessary to attend. Spend a looooong time on one problem. You can teach yourself and take his class.
His class is really easy as long as you do the practice problems, those are ten times tougher than the actual exams.

Berman was probably the worst math teacher I've had in terms of explaining things. He is okay if you do MSI or go to discussion and make sure you are still learning everything. Just practically memorize his study guides.  I recommend doing them all  the weekend before the midterm and then redoing them one more time days before it. Not a hard class.

Berman is a very unclear teacher. He never seems to be able to get his point across. Those who say this class is easy must have a previous record of being fairly good at math. IF YOU ARE NOT GREAT AT MATH AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS! I struggled to pass. Tests are basically like the study guides. Definitely go to MSI.

Berman isn't the best teacher. He tends to go off on tangents and doesn't seem to care about his students in math 3 at all, and the way he goes about solving problems are often times just overly complicated and there's a better way to do it. His class is really easy, though, and his tests are carbon copies of the study guide.

His class was very easy. I don't know why people keep complaining about his teaching. I mean he didn't get to the point sometimes but he is not a bad teacher. If people studied his notes then they shouldn't have any trouble passing the class. It was an easy A for me. Just do the study guides for midterms and final AND study them!! Very helpful.

Berman can be confusing when he lectures and he tends to go off on a tangent. However, the notes themselves are helpful and they have a lot of examples. His lectures really aren't necessary to go to as long as you get the notes from someone.  His tests are relatively easy though, no trick questions and everything on the test is on his practice test

His lectures are very helpful, the HW comes directly from the examples, which I liked. I entered 2 weeks late but passed with a decent grade, just be sure to do the HW!!! He's a nice guy, DOES wear the same clothes everyday, but it goes with that whole "professor-chic" thing I guess.

This guy is great. I retook the class with him and he was much more helpful than my previous professor. He doesn't curve at all but his tests are fair and he only asks you about material that he specifically went over in class.

This guy is great. I retook the class with him and he was much more helpful than my previous professor. He doesn't curve at all but his tests are fair and he only asks you about material that he specifically went over in class. *He looks like Galifinakis!

Berman is an extremely easy teacher! His tests are based off of his practice problems so if you get the practice problems you're good to go. Attend lecture because his homework is based on his lecture. He's really clear while teaching. Oh and he wears the same shirt the whole quarter but that doesn't take about from his teaching. TAKE HIM!

OKay teacher, easiest tests in calculus I've ever taken. Always wears the same thing everyday and only shaves once a quarter, but still, appearance shouldn't matter that much. He does it so students will pay attention more to him than his outfits.

Great professor. The class is just so simple. Attend lectures, take notes, do homework. It's as easy as that. The midterms are identical to the practice tests. The only difference is that they are easier! The final is the same way. He kept saying he'd make it harder but he didn't. I got 100% on the first midterm, 105% on the second. Got an A.

Berman was a fantastic professor. His lectures are clear and he's really passionate about the material. Homework and tests were hard so you WILL have to do work. However, he provides a review sheet prior to every test. As long as you master the review sheet, you'll do just fine. Good teacher, but not very approachable.
HE'S AWESOME. STUDY THE REVIEW SHEETS. SKIM OVER THE BOOK. I LOVED HIM AS MY 11B PROFESSOR :)
Abe Berman is a wonderful math teacher! I really enjoyed having him as my math professor, I got high scores on his tests, his review sheets are all you need to study for his exams! He's awesome!! :]
study practice exams closely and youll be fine but his lectures are pointless.

Abe is a great teacher. He does a lot of examples in class that are on the hw which helps. Also, he really tries to make everything clear, it does get annoying when he repeats himself, but its to your benefit. His tests are really easy if you do the review. Don't buy the book it's a waste of money and I never used it.

Berman, is a very good professor he explains examples very well. His tests are very fair, he makes the review sheets harder than the tests so you are well prepared. Very good professor, highly recommend him. I attended classes and they were very helpful. Don't buy the book,I never used it.

Pro: Predictable in that his class follows a formula, he gives out practice midterms which reflect the tests, he dosn't take role, the hw is online                                                      Con: His tests are only 5 problems long, his practice midterms are hard and often number 20 or more problems, online hw, few in-class examples.

You definitely don't have to be great at math to do well in this class. All it took for me to ace the class was to do the practice exams twice, go to lecture/section, and do a little homework every day. His practice exams are given out a week in advance and are extremely similar to the midterms. There are NO surprises.
He wears the same shirt everyday.  I like that.  Also when he gets really excited about math (which is often) he starts speaking faster and louder.  Anyway the class was easy.

If you show up to lecture and do the review worksheets you should be fine (though you might feel confused at the time). Because the class generally does poorly on the tests, he has an amazing curve system. Wish I could be in his class again! Although he's a bit confusing, he's an awesome professor!

He is a great professor, he may take a while to explain a simple question but helps. I got an A in this class, test are easy similar to review sheet. Also show up to office hours if you do not understand the lecture or homework.

Good lecturer. Goes to indepth with examples not prudent to success in the course. Tests are very similar to the review sheets. No suprises. Very fair grader, Very easy to pass, easy to get a B, and challenging (sort of) to get an A.
He often rambles during lecture, but review sheets are nearly identical to test questions. He wears the same shirt every day... Easy class to pass, but not necessarily easy to get 100%.
Berman was a fairly good teacher. He is repetitive and slighting rambling when explaining proofs that students really do not need to know. Overall though, the class and tests are very easy.
